Java.name: Stairs
Java.template: $package   import plm.universe.turtles.Turtle;  public class Stairs extends Turtle { $body }

Scala.name: Stairs

Python.name: Stairs

helps.en:
The universe of turtles

This is an adaptation of LOGO for the Programmer's Learning Machine.

It is directly inspired from the work of the mathematician Seymour Papert in the 60's. Inspired from the swiss psycholog Jean Piaget, he came up with a learning method called LOGO to teach programming to young childs. The world is full of turtles which leave a painting where they go and which respond to simple orders.

Functions to move the turtle

[!java|c]void [/!]forward([!java|c]double [/!]steps[!scala]:Double[/!])
[!java|c]void [/!]backward([!java|c]double [/!]steps[!scala]:Double[/!])
Moves forward or backward of the requested amount of steps. 
[!java|c]void [/!]right([!java|c]double [/!]angle[!scala]:Double[/!])
[!java|c]void [/!]left([!java|c]double [/!]angle[!scala]:Double[/!])
Turns left or right of the given angle (in degrees). 
[!java|c]double [/!]getX()[!scala]:Double[/!]
[!java|c]double [/!]getY()[!scala]:Double[/!]
Returns the current position of the turtle. Note that the point (0,0) is on the top left corner, as it is often the case in Computer Science. 
[!java|c]void [/!]setX([!java|c]double [/!]x[!scala]:Double[/!])
[!java|c]void [/!]setY([!java|c]double [/!]y[!scala]:Double[/!])
[!java|c]void [/!]setPos([!java|c]double [/!]x[!scala]:Double[/!], [!java|c]double [/!]y[!scala]:Double[/!])
Teleports the turtle to a new position (without leaving any trace). 
[!java|c]void [/!]moveTo([!java|c]double [/!]x[!scala]:Double[/!], [!java|c]double [/!]y[!scala]:Double[/!])
Moves the turtle to a new position. 
[!java|c]void [/!]circle([!java|c]double [/!]radius[!scala]:Double[/!])
Draw a circle of the specified radius centered on the turtle. 
[!java|c]void [/!]hide()
Hides the turtle. 
[!java|c]void [/!]show()
Shows the turtle back. 
[!java]boolean [/!][!c]int [/!]isVisible()[!scala]:Boolean[/!]
Returns whether the turtle is currently visible. 
[!java|c]void [/!]clear()
Removes any trail on the sheet. 
[!java|c]double [/!]getHeading()[!scala]:Double[/!]
Returns the current heading of the turtle (in degrees). 
[!java|c]void [/!]setHeading([!java|c]double [/!]angle[!scala]:Double[/!])
Sets a new heading to the turtle (in degrees).

Functions about the pen

[!java|c]void [/!]penUp()
Moves the pen up (turtles have pens, not brushes as buggles). The turtle will not leave any trace during its subsequent moves. 
[!java|c]void [/!]penDown()
Moves the pen down. The turtle will leave a trace during its subsequent moves. 
[!java]boolean [/!][!c]int [/!]isPenDown()[!scala]:Boolean[/!]
Returns the current pen position as a boolean. 
[!java|c]Color [/!]getColor()[!scala]:Color[/!]
Returns the current pen color. 
[!java|c]void [/!]setColor([!java|c]Color [/!]color[!scala]:Color[/!])
Changes the pen color.

Other functions

[!java]boolean [/!][!c]int [/!]isSelected()[!scala]:Boolean[/!]
Returns whether the current turtle is selected in the graphical interface.

Valid colors

NameColor
[!scala|java|python]Color.[/!]black  
[!scala|java|python]Color.[/!]blue  
[!scala|java|python]Color.[/!]cyan  
[!scala|java|python]Color.[/!]darkGray  
[!scala|java|python]Color.[/!]gray  
[!scala|java|python]Color.[/!]green  
[!scala|java|python]Color.[/!]lightGray 
[!scala|java|python]Color.[/!]magenta  
[!scala|java|python]Color.[/!]orange  
[!scala|java|python]Color.[/!]pink  
[!scala|java|python]Color.[/!]red  
[!scala|java|python]Color.[/!]white  
[!scala|java|python]Color.[/!]yellow
helps.fr:
L'univers des tortues

Cet univers est une adaptation de LOGO pour la Programmer's Learning Machine.

Il est directement inspiré des travaux du mathématicien Seymour Papert dans les années 60. Inspiré par le psychologue suisse Jean Piaget, il a inventé une méthode d'apprentissage de la programmation accessible aux jeunes enfants nommée LOGO. Le monde est peuplé de tortues qui laissent une trace là où elles marchent et à qui on peut donner des ordres simples.

Fonctions pour déplacer la tortue

[!java|c]void [/!]avance([!java|c]double [/!]nbPas[!scala]:Double[/!])
[!java|c]void [/!]recule([!java|c]double [/!]nbPas[!scala]:Double[/!])
Avance ou recule du nombre de pas demandé. 
[!java|c]void [/!]droite([!java|c]double [/!]angle[!scala]:Double[/!])
[!java|c]void [/!]gauche([!java|c]double [/!]angle[!scala]:Double[/!])
Tourne à gauche ou à droite de l'angle indiqué (en degrés). 
[!java|c]double [/!]getX()[!scala]:Double[/!]
[!java|c]double [/!]getY()[!scala]:Double[/!]
Renvoie la position courante de la tortue. L'origine (0; 0) est dans le coin en haut à gauche, comme c'est souvent le cas en informatique. 
[!java|c]void [/!]setX([!java|c]double [/!]x[!scala]:Double[/!])
[!java|c]void [/!]setY([!java|c]double [/!]y[!scala]:Double[/!])
[!java|c]void [/!]setPos([!java|c]double [/!]x[!scala]:Double[/!], [!java|c]double [/!]y[!scala]:Double[/!])
Téléporte la tortue à une nouvelle position (sans laisser de trace). 
[!java|c]void [/!]allerVers([!java|c]double [/!]x[!scala]:Double[/!], [!java|c]double [/!]y[!scala]:Double[/!])
Déplace la tortue à une nouvelle position. 
[!java|c]void [/!]cercle([!java|c]double [/!]rayon[!scala]:Double[/!])
Dessine un cercle du rayon demandé et centré sur la tortue. 
[!java|c]void [/!]cache()
Cache la tortue. 
[!java|c]void [/!]montre()
Montre la tortue. 
[!java]boolean [/!][!c]int [/!]estVisible()[!scala]:Boolean[/!]
Renvoie vrai si la tortue est actuellement visible. 
[!java|c]void [/!]efface()
Efface toutes les traces de la feuille. 
[!java|c]double [/!]getCap()[!scala]:Double[/!]
Retourne le cap actuel de la tortue (en degrés). 
[!java|c]void [/!]setCap([!java|c]double [/!]angle[!scala]:Double[/!])
Change le cap de la tortue à l'angle indiqué (en degrés).

Fonctions à propos du stylo

[!java|c]void [/!]leveCrayon()
Remonte le crayon de la tortue (les tortues ont des crayons, pas des brosses comme les buggles). La tortue ne laissera plus de trace lors de ses déplacements suivants. 
[!java|c]void [/!]baisseCrayon()
Descend le stylo. La tortue laissera une trace lors de ses prochains déplacements. 
[!java]boolean [/!][!c]int [/!]estCrayonBaisse()[!scala]:Boolean[/!]
Retourne si le stylo est actuellement baissé ou non. 
[!java|c]Color [/!]getCouleur()[!scala]:Color[/!]
Retourne la couleur actuelle du stylo. 
[!java|c]void [/!]setCouleur([!java|c]Color [/!]couleur[!scala]:Color[/!])
Modifier la couleur du stylo.

Autres fonctions

[!java]boolean [/!][!c]int [/!]estChoisie()[!scala]:Boolean[/!]
Renvoie si la tortue actuelle est sélectionnée dans l'interface graphique.

Couleurs valides

NomCouleur
[!scala|java|python]Color.[/!]black  
[!scala|java|python]Color.[/!]blue  
[!scala|java|python]Color.[/!]cyan  
[!scala|java|python]Color.[/!]darkGray  
[!scala|java|python]Color.[/!]gray  
[!scala|java|python]Color.[/!]green  
[!scala|java|python]Color.[/!]lightGray 
[!scala|java|python]Color.[/!]magenta  
[!scala|java|python]Color.[/!]orange  
[!scala|java|python]Color.[/!]pink  
[!scala|java|python]Color.[/!]red  
[!scala|java|python]Color.[/!]white  
[!scala|java|python]Color.[/!]yellow

initialWorlds.name: Stairs
initialWorlds.about:
The universe of turtles

This is an adaptation of LOGO for the Programmer's Learning Machine.

It is directly inspired from the work of the mathematician Seymour Papert in the 60's. Inspired from the swiss psycholog Jean Piaget, he came up with a learning method called LOGO to teach programming to young childs. The world is full of turtles which leave a painting where they go and which respond to simple orders.

Functions to move the turtle

void forward(double steps)
void backward(double steps)
Moves forward or backward of the requested amount of steps. 
void right(double angle)
void left(double angle)
Turns left or right of the given angle (in degrees). 
double getX()
double getY()
Returns the current position of the turtle. Note that the point (0,0) is on the top left corner, as it is often the case in Computer Science. 
void setX(double x)
void setY(double y)
void setPos(double x, double y)
Teleports the turtle to a new position (without leaving any trace). 
void moveTo(double x, double y)
Moves the turtle to a new position. 
void circle(double radius)
Draw a circle of the specified radius centered on the turtle. 
void hide()
Hides the turtle. 
void show()
Shows the turtle back. 
boolean isVisible()
Returns whether the turtle is currently visible. 
void clear()
Removes any trail on the sheet. 
double getHeading()
Returns the current heading of the turtle (in degrees). 
void setHeading(double angle)
Sets a new heading to the turtle (in degrees).

Functions about the pen

void penUp()
Moves the pen up (turtles have pens, not brushes as buggles). The turtle will not leave any trace during its subsequent moves. 
void penDown()
Moves the pen down. The turtle will leave a trace during its subsequent moves. 
boolean isPenDown()
Returns the current pen position as a boolean. 
Color getColor()
Returns the current pen color. 
void setColor(Color color)
Changes the pen color.

Other functions

boolean isSelected()
Returns whether the current turtle is selected in the graphical interface.

Valid colors

NameColor
Color.black  
Color.blue  
Color.cyan  
Color.darkGray  
Color.gray  
Color.green  
Color.lightGray 
Color.magenta  
Color.orange  
Color.pink  
Color.red  
Color.white  
Color.yellow
